content.body: So in the latest round of JS-is-missing-features discourse, one request that stands out is for Jack Works ‘s Number.range/BigInt.range. I am wondering, how can we move that forward? Is it blocked on anything?
content.formatted_body: So in the latest round of JS-is-missing-features discourse, one request that stands out is for Jack Works ‘s Number.range/BigInt.range. I am wondering, how can we move that forward? Is it blocked on anything?

content.body: I remember we had some kind of debate around how exactly arguments should work but everyone was positive about it IIRC
I think the main blocker was whether the resulting thing should be one-shot or reusable
and we just need to actually decide
* I think the main blocker was whether the resulting thing should be one-shot or reusable

m.new_content.body: I think the main blocker was whether the resulting thing should be one-shot or reusable

content.body: https://github.com/tc39/proposal-Number.range/issues/17, which is well on its way to being a centithread...
indeed i think that's the open question. some iterators are reusable, so one might expect these to be; but most aren't, so one might expect these not to be
iterators are never reusable, but many iterables are
